greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A000005(n) - A014197(n), where A000005(n) gives the number of divisors of n, and A014197(n) gives the number of integers m with phi(m) = n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20790
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
program: A014197(n, m=1) = { n==1 && return(1+(m<2)); my(p, q); sumdiv(n, d, if( d>=m && isprime(d+1), sum( i=0, valuation(q=n\d, p=d+1), A014197(q\p^i, p))))}; \\ From A014197
xref: Cf. A000005, A014197, A305058 (positions of zeros).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 03 2018
